headline.main: The Big City; Patriotic Act: Asking Waiter For a Steak

lead_paragraph: IF you are looking to do good in these difficult times, Brian Kahn has a proposition perfectly in sync with the zeitgeist. Americans have been told to prepare for sacrifices during the war on terrorism, but so far most of us haven't had to do anything more than stand in line at security checkpoints. In World War II, patriotic civilians put up with rationing of fuel and food. Today Americans are being solemnly urged to stand up to our enemies by traveling to New York and ordering as much food as possible at downtown restaurants.
abstract: John Tierney The Big City column on eating steak in restaurant in lower Manhattan in order to lift city's economy from its post-Sept 11 slump (M)
